name: LIGHTNING
facts: Around the world, this occurs 3,000,000 times a day
Until the late 18th century it was believed that ringing church bells repelled it
Lake Maracaibo in Venezuela is the place on Earth that receives the most
There recorded speed travels at a gentle 270,000 mph.
When it strikes sand, it fuses together the grains to create fulgurite.

name: BALLET
facts: It began in France in 1661
The first to do this were all men!
This performance tells a story without words
The word originates from the Greek word “ballizo”
The performers put rosin on their pointe shoes to prevent slipping

name: AVOCADO

Over 70 million lbs. of these are consumed on Super Bowl Sunday.
The skin and pit can be harmful, and even toxic, to cats and dogs.

name: CHOCOLATE

The word comes from the Aztec word xocoatl,
The Aztecs also interstingly used this as their currency

name: TOOTHBRUSH
facts: It was invented in China during the Tang Dynasty (619-907)
The world's most expensive costs US$4,000. It's made of titanium
The average person spends a total of 38.5 days of their life using this
The ancient Egyptians used twigs and leaves instead of this
One in ten people admit they regularly forget to brush their teeth.

name: LANTERN
facts: They were originally made of metal and paper in ancient China and Japan.
They are symbols of hope, guidance, and celebration in many cultures.
People carried them in medieval times to navigate dark streets.
Modern ones use LEDs, making them safer and more energy-efficient.
The word 'lantern' comes from the Latin 'lanterna', meaning lamp or torch.

name: BALLOON
facts: Originally made from animal bladders, rubber versions emerged in the 19th century.
They are often used in science to measure atmospheric conditions.
In some cultures, releasing them is a symbol of letting go.
They are now commonly made from latex or foil for durability.
Helium-filled versions float because helium is lighter than air.

name: LUGGAGE
facts: It was traditionally made of wood and leather for durability.
Wheeled versions were introduced in the 1970s, revolutionizing travel.
It can range from hard-shell cases to soft, expandable fabric types.
Modern models often include locks, compartments, and charging ports.
It is designed to protect belongings and organize items for transport.

name: BATTERY
facts: The first version was created by Italian scientist Alessandro Volta in 1800.
Some types can be recharged over 1,000 times before wearing out.
They rely on chemical reactions to generate an electric current.
A few types contain lithium, making them lightweight and long-lasting.
Recycling programs exist for old ones to reduce toxic waste.

name: BLENDER
facts: The first one was invented in 1922 by a Polish-American named Stephen Poplawski.
Some models can spin at speeds over 30,000 RPM.
Specialized versions are used to mix industrial products like paint.
High-power models can heat soups just by blending them at high speeds.
They are popular in labs for creating chemical solutions.

name: FOSSILS
facts: Some types are so delicate they are only visible under a microscope.
They can form from animals, plants, or even microorganisms like algae.
Petrification is one process by which organic material turns into stone.
They are often found in sedimentary rock layers and dated using carbon dating.
They are preserved remains of ancient life forms.

name: PILLOWS
facts: In ancient Mesopotamia, only the wealthy used them, made from stone.
Specialized ones can be designed to support different sleeping postures.
Feathers, memory foam, and polyester are common filling materials.
Some types are infused with lavender for a calming sleep effect.
They are used for head support while sleeping.

name: TROUSERS
facts: In the 19th century, women who wore them were considered rebellious.
They became common women's clothing during World War II.
Many designs include pockets, although some are purely decorative.
They can be made from materials like denim, cotton, and wool.
They are worn on the legs and commonly referred to as pants.

name: TAPESTRY
facts: They often tell stories, with famous ones depicting battles or legends.
Medieval versions were used to insulate stone walls and provide warmth.
They are handwoven on a loom, a process that can take years.
Some are hung as decorative wall art in homes and museums.
They are textile art pieces made by weaving colored threads.

name: BINOCULARS
facts: The design was influenced by opera glasses, used in 19th-century theaters.
They can be waterproof for use in marine environments or hiking.
Adjustable focus allows users to see distant objects clearly.
They are commonly used by birdwatchers, hunters, and sports fans.
They help magnify distant objects, making them appear closer.

name: MICROWAVE
facts: The first commercial version weighed over 700 pounds and was water-cooled.
They work by vibrating water molecules in food, creating heat.
Some models include convection settings for baking or crisping.
They are a common feature in kitchens for quickly heating meals.
They are appliances that use electromagnetic waves to heat food.

name: MICROSCOPE
facts: The first compound version was developed in the 17th century by Zacharias Janssen.
In the 19th century, it was integral in advancing the field of biology.
Some modern versions use lasers to create sharper images of tiny objects.
They are crucial in medical labs for diagnosing diseases at the cellular level.
They are optical instruments used to magnify small objects or organisms.

name: HANDKERCHIF
facts: In many ancient cultures, this item was originally made from luxurious materials such as silk
In 14th-century Europe, they were considered a symbol of status, often elaborately decorated.
In some cultures, it became a fashion accessory, especially among the aristocracy.
Modern versions are often used for hygiene, and are commonly made from cotton or linen.
A small piece of cloth used for personal hygiene or as a decorative accessory.

name: FISHHOOKS
facts: The earliest examples of this item date back over 23,000 years, found in ancient cultures.
In modern times, they are usually made from metal, sometimes with barbs for better grip.
This tool has evolved to suit various types of fishing, with designs specific to different fish.
They are often used in combination with bait to catch fish, especially in recreational fishing.
A sharp object used in fishing, designed to catch fish by hooking them in the mouth.

name: ELEPHANTS
facts: The ancestors of these massive creatures date back 55 million years to the Eocene Epoch.
These animals are known for their intelligence, social structure, and complex communication.
They are the largest land mammals, with males growing to over 12 feet tall and weighing up to 6 tons.
Their trunks are highly versatile, used for drinking, picking up objects, and vocalizations.
The largest land animals, characterized by their trunks, tusks, and large ears.

name: FISHHOOKS
facts: The earliest examples of this item date back over 23,000 years, found in ancient cultures.
This tool has evolved to suit various types of fishing, with designs specific to different fish.
In modern times, they are usually made from metal, sometimes with barbs for better grip.
They are often used in combination with bait to catch fish, especially in recreational fishing.
A sharp object used in fishing, designed to catch fish by hooking them in the mouth.

name: LAVENDER
facts: Its flowers contain essential oils that have been prized for their calming effects.
Historically, it was believed to ward off evil spirits and purify the air in homes.
This plant has been used for thousands of years in perfumes, medicine, and cosmetics.
Today, it's commonly used in aromatherapy and as a natural remedy for anxiety.
A fragrant purple flower, often used in oils, perfumes, and healing remedies.

name: MUSKETEER
facts: This historical figure was known for carrying a firearm, part of a specialized unit.
The term was popularized in 17th-century France, particularly in military contexts.
These soldiers were often part of the king's guard, skilled in combat and warfare.
Their signature weapon was a musket, a firearm used during the Age of Firearms.
A soldier equipped with a musket, often part of a royal army or military elite.

name: CURRENCY
facts: The first metal coins were minted in Lydia around 600 BCE, initiating widespread use.
Historically, shells and precious metals were used as a form of exchange
Today, it includes both physical money and digital representations like banknotes and coins.
The introduction of paper money began in China during the Tang Dynasty in the 7th century.
A system of money in general use, particularly for trade and exchange of goods.

name: BOTTLE
facts: This object was first made from clay and glass before being mass-produced in the 19th century.
Historically, it was used to hold liquids like wine, oil, and perfumes for storage.
The design of this object has evolved significantly over the centuries, now available in plastic and glass.
Today, it is used extensively for packaging beverages, especially water and soft drinks.
A container with a narrow neck used to hold liquids, typically made of glass or plastic.

name: PAPERCLIP
facts: The first patent for this object was issued in 1899, although similar versions existed earlier.
In the early 20th century, its design was modified to make it more reliable and less likely to rust.
Today, it is a ubiquitous office supply used to bind sheets of paper together temporarily.
This simple item is often made from wire and is available in various sizes for different uses.
A small device made of metal used to hold sheets of paper together.

name: TOURNAMENT
facts: In the Middle Ages, these events were often a display of knightly skills and combat.
They included jousting, sword fighting, and archery as ways to prove strength and skill.
The modern version began in the 19th century with organized sports like tennis and golf.
It typically involves multiple rounds, with competitors or teams advancing to finals.
A competitive event where participants compete in a series of games or challenges to determine a winner.

This tool has evolved to suit various types of fishing, with designs specific to different fish.
In modern times, they are usually made from metal, sometimes with barbs for better grip.
They are often used in combination with bait to catch fish, especially in recreational fishing.
